answers.answer: I think i have your same situation. Does this mean we need a Csec?
I read online it can be a possibility but I'm not sure
It doesn't mean anything! My daughter was 2 lbs bigger than what she was supposed to be but she was the easiest vaginal delivery I had! She was 9 lbs. 15 oz.

Both my husband and I are tall and I have consistently measured big, the drs just say it's a long baby and I have a lot of fluid...just be aware of the fluid stuff because they said they need to keep an eye on it because it can let them move around too much. You could just have a longer baby...also all pregnancies are different and that may be normal for you!

I'm 31w1d and just had an ultrasound where they said baby was measuring 32w.  Estimated 3lbs 15ozs.  A month ago at the last ultrasound, we were told baby was measuring a week behind so I guess baby (or maybe mamma) got hungry!  I'm hoping weight gain stays consistent for the remaining time!

At my 29 week 3d ultra sound my bahy was mwasuring 31 weeks and almost 4 pounds already! 3d tech said baby is pretty big and might b close to 8 pounds! I emailed my real obgyn and said she isnt worried right now aince my diabetes test came back negative so we wud diacuss at my next appt

I'm 27weeks and my little angel was already over 2lbs a month ago. So imagine how big I am! I've had 3 ultrasounds to make sure she's the only one in there.. My stomach so big I can't even drive anymore! I try no to leave home.. Life is very uncomfortable now..

I consistently carried two weeks ahead with my first pregnancy. He was measuring big, my doc even tested me for gestational diabetes twice (both tests negative). Eventually she just told me that some women have a more nourishing placenta. I think that was her nice way of telling me to quit eating so much, lol. Anyway, my water broke at 35 weeks, and my son was 6 lb 3 oz.

I've been measuring 2 weeks ahead as well. I'm 38 weeks and the baby is already measuring 40 weeks so I'm afraid when I get to 40 weeks the baby will be huge.  I was hoping that my due date was wrong because it was changed in the beginning pushed back by 27 days so I was hoping that maybe they just pushed it back too far...but the ultrasound tech last week said probly not she said in the third trimester it just means the baby is big not that you are farther along than you thought....but you never know because even the early ultrasounds can be a week or two off. My Dr is keeping an eye on the baby's size I have my weekly apt tomorrow and he might send me for another ultrasound to check the weight again. He said he might induce me if needed. I'm just hoping the baby comes by himself a little early. The Dr even said that maybe I will go a week early. He's not huge yet but I'm afraid if he stays in too much longer he will be. the ultrasound said 7 lbs 6 ounces last week. Ultrasiunds can be innacurate though a pound over or under. So I'm hoping maybe he is smaller I'm praying he's not bigger. The Dr felt the baby by pressing on my stomach and said the baby doesn't feel that big even though my stomach is huge.I've had people ask me if I'm having twins....I'm still afraid one is hiding. The Dr said he could feel the entire baby the head and butt and he didn't even feel like 7.6 lbs so I don't knoe.... I think i just carry big. Im small and i didnt even gain that much weight. Im a picky eater and dont eat that much...so i dont know how the baby got big. So we will see.

Same situation here...   I'm 36 weeks and everyone asks me if I'm carring "multiples" and if im about to give birth... It's so uncomfortable And sometimes painful. The skin feels like its going to rip any second. I'm afraid of the natural delivery with a huge baby.  My husband weighed 10 lbs when he was born, i was a (6-month)  premature baby weighing about 2 lbs. I asked my obgyn the last time she said that you never know if the baby will fit unless you try, is that true????Thank you for your advice.

The baby will fit!! My daught was 1 oz away from being 10 lbs and she was 22inches long. She was the easiest labor I had! Don't worry or stress your self out your baby is healthy and fine! Just listen to your doctor

Actually, my Obgyn told me my baby is huge!!   last week I was 36 weeks and it was measueing 38. My pelvic bones are posirioned in a different way,so she don't think its going to work out, but she said i can try....

question: Hey guys I'm a 25yr old FTM 29 wks today and I went for my check up visit and I was told that I'm carrying like I'm 32 weeks?! I go for a ultrasound in two weeks not nervous just kind of wondering does that mean he a big baby or are there other things that could be going on...please help me understand thanks. :-)
title: carrying bigger than expected anyone???
